result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONDITIONS.
Court will allow the defendant to move to Alaska.  Defendant is to have remote breath tests.  Defendant is to remain on WCS monitoring.  Court will remove SCRAM monitoring.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.  Defendant to have no contact with victim the defendant hit and ran from listed in the Criminal Complaint with the exception of 3rd party contact for insurance purposes.

Case called at 9:54 AM for a Bail/Bond Hearing.
Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren in court for Jesse E Butler. 
Defendant Jesse E Butler in court.  
Attorney Lindgren makes statements to the court with a proposal plan.
State objects to the defendant leaving the State of Wisconsin.
Court will MODIFY the conditions of the defendant's bail:
Defendant is to stay on SCRAM monitoring until the defendant leaves the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is to provide proof of travel arrangements including a airplane ticket to travel to Alaska.
Defendant to participate in an in-patient treatment plan in Juneau, Alaska arrangements to be determined.

Case called at 9:10 a.m. State appeared in court by Assistant District Attorney Kristi Gordon.  Attorney Kathleen Lindgren appeared in court with Jesse E. Butler.  Jesse E. Butler appeared in court.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant waiver his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court accepts the defendant's waiver of prelim.  Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.  Bail remains as fixed.  Information filed.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the information, waived reading and enters a Not Guilty plea.  Case to follow 21CF1060.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
